resources.string: You are subscribed to Kamtjatka notifications

Do you have any questions about the Danish way of life? Would you like to know more places to socialize in Horsens? Or do you want to make a career for yourself at one of the many interesting companies in the Horsens area? Our welcome guide is your helping hand when settling in Horsens. Please contact BusinessHorsens to learn more. BusinessHorsens can also arrange for you to talk to one of our welcome ambassadors – a group of knowledgeable and friendly volunteer international citizens who are eager to answer any practical questions you might have about settling and living in Horsens. BusinessHorsens Vitus Bering Innovation Park Chr. M. Østergaards Vej 4a DK-8700 Horsens Phone: +45 7561 1888 E-mail: mail@businesshorsens.dk Opening hours: Monday - Thursday: 8.00 am - 3.00 pm and Friday 8.00 am - 2.00 pm

To make sure that you have all the right papers and registrations you need in order to be able to work and live in Denmark, we have collected some information for you about the official matters to take care of when moving to Denmark. International Citizen Service – all the services you need in one place The International Citizen Service (ICS) makes dealing with Danish authorities as easy as pos- sible – for you, your partner, and for Danish companies that employ foreign workers. You will find an International Citizen Service office in each of the four largest cities in Den- mark: Copenhagen, Aarhus, Odense and Aalborg. The Municipality of Horsens works with ICS Aarhus to ensure that you get off to a good start in Denmark and Horsens. All the public authorities you typically need to deal with are represented at ICS Aarhus. In most cases, you will only need to talk to your ICS office to take care of your paperwork and find answers to your questions.

It is always the responsibility of the tenants to keep the apartment clean and tidy.For health reasons, but also to prevent damage to the buildings, apartments should be cleaned on a weekly basis. Bathrooms and kitchen twice a week No garbage bags on the floors, throw them out or have them in bins. Clean up after you when you have been using the common rooms.

During the first 5 days after your tenancy begins, we will be conducting an inspection of your room. You will receive an invitation, but you are not required to be present. After the inspection you will receive an inspection report about the state of your room. If you do not agree with the inspection, or if you encounter defects not mentioned, you must notify us in writing within 2 weeks after the tenancy beginning date. Report to contract@kamtjatka.dk Also please count the inventory on the inventory list you have received, and return the list 2 weeks after the tenancy beginning date. This way you will not be held liable for damages or shortcomings.

For safety and documentation purposes, email must be used for maintenance requests. Send a detailed description of the problem to contract@kamtjatka.dk We will tent to problems as fast as possible. For issues in common areas we will gain access to the apartment and leave a note. If maintenance is required in your private room, you must be home or give explicit consent to our staff entering the room without you present.

Broken keys can be replaced at the office. You will be charged for the replacement key, currently dkk 250,00. If the key is broken inside the lock, a locksmith will be called and you will be charged the related cost. If you lose a key, we will need to recode the locks. You will be charged the related cost, currently dkk 1.850,00. For calls outside of normal working hours regarding lost or broken keys, you will be charged a service fee of dkk 400,00.

When your contract is coming to an end, you will receive information from us on email regarding the checkout. When planning your trip back home please note that checkout is only done on weekdays and only in normal business hours. Please schedule travel accordingly.

Parking of bicycles are only allowed in designated areas or storage rooms. Bicycles are not allowed inside the apartments. All bicycles must be sticker with your room number. This sticker can be collected at the office.

Drosselbo has a non-smoking policy inside all buildings, the policy includes tenants as well as visitors. Any tenant violating the nonsmoking policy will be liable to pay damages including a total repaint of discolored walls.
